title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Suspect identified in murder of mother and son in Karandeniya
byline: A suspect has been identified in connection with the incident of the murder of a 74-year-old woman and her 25-year-old son in  Karandeniya, according to police.

title: Brazil’s ex-president Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years after landmark coup plot conviction
byline: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was sentenced on Thursday to 27 years and three months in prison hours after being convicted of plotting a coup to remain in power after losing the 2022 election, dealing a powerful rebuke to one of the world’s most prominent far-right populist leaders.

title: Six live exotic snakes found in female passenger’s luggage at BIA
byline: Six live exotic snakes were seized at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) from a Sri Lankan national arriving from Bangkok via Chennai on a IndiGo Airlines flight, Sri Lanka Customs said.

title: Harsha raises concerns over Bribery Commission’s financial management
byline: The Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (CoPF), MP Dr. Harsha de Silva, has raised concerns regarding the financial management of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), questioning whether the institution can be considered truly independent under its current framework.

title: China to provide Sri Lanka’s full requirement of school uniforms for 2026
byline: The Chinese government has agreed to provide the full requirement of school uniform material required for 4,418,404 government and government-aided school students in Sri Lanka for the year 2026 as a grant.

title: Paramount Skydance preparing bid for Warner Bros Discovery
byline: Paramount Skydance is preparing a bid to buy Warner Bros Discovery, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday, potentially bringing together two storied Hollywood studios and reshaping the entertainment industry.

title: ‘True strength comes from our roots, not positions or privileges’ – Namal
byline: In a post on ‘X’ (formerly Twitter), SLPP Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa, son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, has reflected on his father’s departure from the official residence on Wijerama Road, Colombo 07.

title: Central govt and provincial institutions must work in unison when implementing development projects - President advises Governors and Secretaries
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has stressed the importance of close coordination and joint action between the central government and provincial institutions in the implementation of development projects, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: SC grants leave to proceed with petition over electricity bill for Namal’s wedding
byline: The Supreme Court (SC) has granted leave to proceed with the hearing of a fundamental rights petition filed by an attorney seeking a ruling that the fundamental rights of the people of this country have been violated by the failure to pay over Rs. 2 million to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB)...

title: Investigators in Charlie Kirk killing find weapon, release images of person of interest
byline: U.S. investigators on Thursday released photos and a video of a person of interest in the fatal shooting of influential conservative activist Charlie Kirk and said they had found the rifle believed to have been used in the politically charged killing.

title: Shasheendra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa, who faces allegations of offenses under the Public Property Act, has been further remanded until September 19 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Chinese Ambassador calls on former President Ranil
byline: A special meeting between former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and the Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Qi Zhenhong, was held last morning (11) at the political party office on Flower Road, Colombo.

title: CP Radhakrishnan sworn in as India’s 15th Vice President
byline: Chandrapuram Ponnusamy Radhakrishnan was on Friday sworn in as the 15th Vice President of India, at a formal ceremony held at Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi.

title: Lotus Road in Colombo closed due to protest march
byline: Lotus Road in Colombo Fort has been closed to vehicular traffic due to a protest march organised by banking sector trade unions, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: No decision yet to arrest Udaya Gammanpila, court informed
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has informed the Court of Appeal today that no decision has been made at this time to arrest former Minister Udaya Gammanpila.

title: Govt’s policy to ensure every rupee is directed towards most productive investments – President at apparel sector pre-budget discussion
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that the government’s objective is to achieve future economic growth targets based on the current stability within the country.

title: Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thero granted bail
byline: Former Member of Parliament Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thero has been granted bail by the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court today (12).

title: Two passengers held with mobile phones, tablets and cosmetics worth Rs. 5M at BIA
byline: Two passengers attempting to smuggle a stock of undeclared mobile phones, tablet computers, cosmetics and boxes of tobacco rolling papers worth Rs. 5 million in total have been arrested by customs officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake during the early hours today (12).

title: US sues Uber, alleges discrimination against disabled riders
byline: The U.S. government on Thursday sued Uber Technologies, accusing the ride-sharing company of violating federal law by discriminating against passengers with disabilities.

title: Seven including pre-school children injured in Norwood accident
byline: An accident has occurred in the New Weligama area of Norwood on the Hatton-Bogawantalawa main road this morning (12) when a speeding three-wheeler collided head-on with a car arriving in the opposite direction.

title: Sri Lanka makes big jump in Global Democracy Rankings
byline: Sri Lanka has moved up 15 places in the 2025 Global Democracy Index compared to the previous year, according to the latest report by an intergovernmental democracy watchdog.

title: Kabir Hashim appointed as new COPA Chair
byline: SJB Member of Parliament Kabir Hashim has been appointed as the new Chair of the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) for the first session of the Tenth Parliament.

title: Prince Harry vows to help war injured during surprise visit to Ukraine
byline: Prince Harry has made a surprise visit to Kyiv, after an invitation by an organisation that supports Ukrainians with life-changing injuries caused by the war.

title: Indictments served on Ramith Rambukwella
byline: The Bribery Commission has filed indictments before the Colombo High Court against Ramith Rambukwella, son of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, for failing to disclose the source of allegedly illegally acquired assets valued at over Rs. 270 million.

title: Sri Lanka sets sights on welcoming 500,000 Indian travellers
byline: Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau has launched its first-ever dedicated destination wedding promotion for the Indian market, marking a new chapter in strengthening tourism ties between the two neighbours. NORE..

title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect identified as Tyler Robinson
byline: The suspect arrested in connection with the shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk has been identified as Tyler Robinson, a 22-year-old man from Utah, authorities said Friday.

title: CoPF calls for financial autonomy for Bribery Commission, AG’s Dept
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (CoPF) has granted approval for the 2026 budget estimate of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: ‘Pac Angel 25’ highlights US commitment to excellence and partnership in Indo-Pacific: US envoy
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka, together with the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) and the Ministry of Defense, marked the successful conclusion of Exercise Pacific Angel 2025 at a closing ceremony in Katunayake today.

title: Former chief justice Karki named Nepal’s first female leader after unrest
byline: Sushila Karki, a former chief justice, will become the first woman to lead Nepal, to be sworn in as interim leader later on Friday after violent anti-graft protests forced Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli to resign, the president’s office said.

title: Boat capsizes in Congo, killing 86 people, most of them students
byline: At least 86 people have died after a motorized boat capsized in northwestern Congo’s Equateur Province, state media reported on Friday.

title: Albania’s leader says his new Cabinet includes an AI ‘minister’ to fight corruption
byline: Albania’s leader said Friday his new cabinet will include an artificial intelligence “minister” that will be in charge of running public funding projects and fighting corruption in public tenders.

title: Trump says suspect in Charlie Kirk murder in custody
byline: A suspect in the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk at a Utah university has been taken into custody, U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday, ending an intense manhunt that followed what Trump described as a “heinous assassination.”
